Hi Dana, I remember you talked about having a world cup of MMA, i always wondered if it ever did happen, Did you have any ideas how to keep the fighters healty and ready for 3 or 4 fights in a week... with some kind of protective gear or maybe shorter fights?

The question that always bothered me was that when we know all of this, how is the broader audienc not realising that every single post with any brand in it is payed for by the company and because of it the same as " 9out of 10 dentists recomend the xxx brand"...i was sure that people are going to see thru it and that the buble is going to burst but that doesnt seem to happen...sotz for bad english

WRITING.TITLE: Diabetes type 1 with Fasting
WRITING.TEXT: Hy guys, i have type 1 diabetes, and just switched from intermiten fasting to prolongued fasting, wondering if any of you do the same, and if you have any advice, especialy regarding insulin doses

Thnx for the advice, unfortunately in my country finding a doctor that remotly anderstands fasting is quite imposible, dont wory i'm taking it slow and measuring glucose levels every step of the way :)

Thnx for the advice bro, unfortunately finding a doctor with knoledge about the subject proved to be a bit dificult...so had to rely on studies, tried a 48 for the first time, took it slow, monitored blood sugar leveks often, felt great, blood glucose levels were excelent also https://pubmed.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/17367310/
Well the 2001 incident could be used to create the much needed war, and because of that was put all over the media, this one however is uselees so just ignore it...

Usualy a simptom of diabetes is feeling realy thirsty and drinking too much water (the body is tryung to wash of the sugar) so i dont think this is it... I cutently have a similar problem, been fasting 18-6, and 20-4 for almost 2 months without problem, now i switched to a keto diet and for the last 7 8 days, i have been feeling light headed and week, hope it's the keto flu, if something doesnt change in the next week its back to the drawing biard :)

I think that a part of the problem here is that white belts don't go and watch tehniques like open guard position basics, they go straight to flying scizor MF chokes and wind up just wasting their time... It's great to watch you tube but maybe it's not a bad idea to consult with your instructor about wht to watch
The GOAT

WRITING.TITLE: Type 1 diabetic, HIIT exercises on keto diet
WRITING.TEXT: Hy guys, Sorry for the long post...but I recently started a keto-fasting diet (3 mothns fasting, added the keto part 4 weeks ago) It has been grate for my blood sugars and ins. Dosages also. My truobles began when i went back to training (after the corona brake , boxing and weightlifting) I started having weird reactions when training fasted or with very low insulin, my blood sugar was rising after exercising to the point that yesterday i had to take 4 units of Apidra before brekfast just to cope with the gluconeogenesis from the liver i guess. (Dont know if my muscles are now using less carbonhydrates and because of that i see the rise in blood sugar or is the liver simply creating carbonhydrates to meet the demand) And yes weirdly enouph ih I have a meal with 20gr of Carbonhidrates (5 units od apidra) before the exercise, it all goes back to the way it was before (exercise lowering my blood sugar) Did anyone had similar expirience, Sorry for the crapy english..
I'm 90% sure that this is the case... What bugs me is that i havent expirienced it before going low carb...or maybe did but atributed it to a mistake in some other input...thnx for the list ..

WRITING.TITLE: Purposlely overshooting on Lantus - Keto diet
WRITING.TEXT: Hy guys, I've been reading on this subject for a while now, but it's hard to find articles.. Basicly the idea is to overshoot on lantus in the morning, and then throuout the day you make a stady rise in blood sugar with a very low carb and fairly high protein diet (fat consumtion goes without saying) If your BG starts going too low it wont be as fast as with overshooting with apidra so its basicly very ease to notice it ob time. Afcourse bolus insulin is added if you consume a bigger meal than usual or a bit more carbonhydrates . Thia should put your BG in a fairly stady cycle. The main problem i have is how to incorporate high intensity training into the mix because it some times seem to rise BG and some rimes lower it. Also a downside is having to be on a schedule with eating (but having 10 gr of sugar in a pocket is not the worst thing in the world) I was wondering if anyone has any expirience or did anyone tried it.. Sorry for the bad english

Well no... First regarding the night... You eat more protein..so 3 4 5 hours after dinner they are going to turn to glucose + Lantus is weaker in the last 6 hours of it's cicle... Regards the next 24 hours...you dont know in advance but you know it's going to drop constantly ...so you just i dont know eat an aple or two if you need more sugar before a walk or something like that... No need for weight loss curentlz... 184 cm with 87 kg... Moustly muscles...haven checked the BMI to be onest..

Yes but then i have to inject two times for each meal , and if i eat two times in let say 4 hours i just got a mess... Gonna try that to definetly... Also R insulins are suposed to last longer to cover the protein...thats my option number 2 ....
Sory allso wanted to add that being in ketosis makes you a bit more imune to bad thing with hypo... Because your brain can fuel from ketones...also i'm gonna carry some glucose with me al the time ..

Well a lot of long acting yes...but 20% more than usual, instead of short acting doses, lesens the overall insulin, keps you in ketosis and hopefully stables the blood sugar, im not loading on kcal's just pushing them with fats up to 1800-2000 so i wouldn lose weight wheather in fat or musce mass.... The goal is to make for a smuuth glycemic ride.. i read that some people had succes with this aproach so im trying it curently
Why do you think it's more dangerous than guesing with apidra like we usualy do..just so we are clear im not dosing 200% of lantus...maybe 120%...i used to take 24 units now i take 31...

Finaly someone...i have two questions...if tou could help maybe... First how do you dose for proteins...i menaged to google two solutions...one is giving 2 rounds of apidra one for CH and another one for protei 2 hours later....secobd solution is switching to actrapid (regular insulin) wich is slower... Second thing is high insulin training..i notised that since i started keto it raises my blood sugar significantly... Any advice on how to dose for it?
Do you also plan for strees, water consumption, every single phisical activity you do...i did the same with my doctor that wasnt my point...unfortunately we are always guessing
Are u on a keto diet or eating high carbs... I have some questions about high intensity training on keto maybe you can help?
Hi, i have some questions on high intensity training on a keto diet regarding insulin dosages... And also Lantus only BG management on keto if you have aa minut or two

Well in the morning your corrizol adrenalin etc are rising giving you elevated BG... If you are on a low carb diet some gluconeogenesis might acure also... Something that has worked for me is giving Lantus in the morning instead of before bad... Usualy i set the alarm at 6 inject and go back to sleep to up around 8... It also lowered my night hypos since it kind of has less of a kick in the last 6 hours of its 24 hour cycle

Well first whats worked for me was giving lantus in the morning... This prevented nigthly hypos because it kind of has less of a kick in the end of the 24 hour cycle... Sekond thin is have some sugar cubes at bed side, the second u wake up have the usual amount its 3 for me cause im on a low carbonhydrate diet but it can be as much as you need... Any way once you get that feeling of "ok i now that 5 is enouph i just have to wait now" it gets easier for me not to eat anything else...

Well generaly the body becomes imune to caffein when its used regulary..or at least less affected ... Thats why coffe drinkers can drink 5 cups of coffe a day and not feel a thing... Thats also why athletes make breaks when using caffein to boost performance... Similar thing happend to me after my first hospitalization, i didnt drink coffe for 30 days, the first cup after i got out raised ma pulse to the point that i couldnt sit stil and went for a run :)..not a glucose effect but you get the idea.. Im guessing that it was the case with you also... So my advice like with everything else for T1s either you do it all the time and it becomes a part of tour daily routine, so you can predict it or just switch to water or lemonade i guess
I considered doing the half half aproach... But ended up just giving 2U of apidra and no lantus before going to bed... Woke up a bit high and gave Lantus in the morning...continued ever since
Post here if you do, i would like to know has it worked for you..

In one of your links (the one about exercise) is explained that high dosages of insulin prevent glucagon release and that because of that the body cant corect the load by itself... So it kind of contradicts your logic...for that subject

WRITING.TITLE: Little or No Bolus insulin
WRITING.TEXT: Hy guys, i Have started Keto diet 2 months ago ,(Trying to be under 20 gr of CH) Since then i dramaticly redused my bolus dosages, Maybe 2U per meal of Apidra, but unfortunately 4 or 5 times a day (for just 2 meals) to cover protein intake. 3 days ago i increased my Lantus by some 20%, in an attempt to cover the proteins that way... (been 24 now i take 30 or 31 U) Funny thing happend... I dont need bolus insulin at all since then.. ,I havent taken it for 3 days now, and my highest blood sugar was 8.1mmol and that was because i ate a bit much on purpose before bed time...you know just in case... At other times i've been under 5.5, and i checked 20 times in 2.5 days... I did however ate 2 times when my sugar was at 3.9 mmol, but only two bites of apple one time and another a handfull of blueberries. Somwhow i had a feeling my BG wouldn't drop bellow that anyway bit just in case... Has anyone had similar expirience with Keto, Or also if anyobe used R insulins on keto diet i would like to hear your expirience
4 - 6 units of bolus i Guess? I also have a filling that my body is menaging the potential lows when overall insulin is low... Dont have any science yet to back it up thou

Didbyou bolua separetly for protein...tha seemd to be a chalenge for me... They are said to raise blood sugar on a low carb diet but with a delay of maybe 3 -4 hours....maybe i ate too much...some 140gr-160gr per day...

"The reduced insulin concentration enables the secretion of glucagon from the pancreatic #160; #945;-cells into the portal vein, which stimulates hepatic glucose output" It's from your second link from above

But without functioning alpha cells would it realy matter how much glycogen your liver has? That's what confuses me... I'm currently in keto , and light exercises had been fairly easy to menage, two bites of apple and im good to go... High intensity is what im currently strugling with, not in terms of performance... But im having a problem anticipating in wich direction my blood glucose is going to go.... Between insulin concetration, gluconeogenesis, adrenalin, cortisol on the last 10 days it has gone both way, some times lowering some times raising my BG. Thebonly pattern that i have notised is that if i train in the evenings its the hypos, and in the morning hypers... Wich is a bit confusing, since i take maybe 4 units total of apidra throuout the day, so you can realy say that in some times i have a much higher insulin concetration... I see that you are in deep on the subject , any advice would be helpfull A litle p.s. i train brasilian jiu jitsu and boxing so the content of energy expenditure can also be dificult to predict before the exercise itself...

Yea thats what bothers me the most... The only good thing in it is that my usual meal contains about 10 gr of CH, so if im not in a situation to eat a full keto meal, a small apple woulld keep me going for the next 3-4 hours if not more, ... Following up cardio with weights seems like a great idea... It crosed my mind earliee today...il definetly try it now since you do it also... Prpbably will try it in reverse order however..
Sori to join the discusion...i was just wondering wich insulin do you use..when you are on keto?
Well maybe because of usualy high blood sugars, your body reacts to normal ones as it would to a Hypo... When my BG is under 3, there is 0% chance for sex... Even at 4 i dont realy feel like it
I used to pee around 10 times a day...since i started Keto im down to maybe 4...wich is strange since low insulin is suposed to increase water release...
Try working out in the morning...before breakfast..it's done wonders for me in terms of low bg...

The bestthing in the world is the Kero diet, It lowered my bolus insulin intakw by 80%, Basal by 30%... I have low sugar maybe once every 2 weeks... It sorted my dawn efect, it seems to had lowered my BG responcecto strees.... And lowerd my A1c by som 2% ... I lost 12pounds and am feeling necer better... However I need insulin now for High intensity training now..and it gets a bit boring from time to time...but thats a small setback... At least for my it worked that way..would advise it to any T1D...ofcourse with consulting your dr...
Why not just do intermiten fasting and skip breakfast altogether... It works for me...

I have been diabetic for 14 years... I,m 4 months in to keto diet...my sugar has never been better... It is kind of challenging, and boring on some ocasions...but just stick to it...the god fealling, great BG , energy and yes looks (i lost som 16 pounds, an currently am at 12% fat) are much more revarding than pizza... There are much mire beautifull things in life than junkfood... And the biggest mith is that it gets boring over longer periods... You get used to it...and it gets easier... In any restaurant you can order something more or less keto..some steak or salad... If you are drinking..just go with the white vine..it gets you drunk just as anything else... I cant even get my self to eat pasta or pizza now, since i know what it does to me... A good beginers trick is to leave anything you crave over the week for sundays lunch...one meal a week will satisfy the cravings..and just be a bit more alert in thise 6 hours after... 6h vs 196h a week is nothing... Trust me un 4 5 weeks you'll choose to skip the cheat meal 100%... At least thats my experience.. Keep safe and well
He also trys to stop me from keto.. And basicly from everything that isnt writen in a 40 years old book
I guess im in luck for not having the dawn efect .. i just recently found out the its a thing :).. i do train in the morning however
F no :)
Mabe Try keto diet... Ive gone periods with lantus only...

With whatever diet you are doing (keto for me) intermiten fasting seems to make a life much more simpler...(once you get good basal dose) For 18hours a day, i dont need bolus, no need to think about how much and what and where and when.... Fornthe first time in my life i actually started to forget by bolus at home..(nott that its a good thing, but it shows that i'm not obsesed with eating and insulins)... The 6 hours you do eat, take the time to plan your dosages and meals... It helped alot..
Go keto... It makes everything much simpler...itts kind of boring to stick to...but man, it does wonders for BG

Its the only thing in the world that works...i know that every one is different but maan did it change my life... Some benefits that i had or have noticed: 40% lower basal 80-90% lower bolus (went from 45U a day to maybe 4-6) Almost no low BG, despite what you may hear about lows on keto becauae of low carbonhydrates ammounts, the low ammount of insulin virtualy eradicates those... No dawn effect.. Stress and adrenalin etc raises the BG much less, i guess because of the empty liver... Overall stable BG, no CH means no sudden peaks, .. The lows are muuuch kore easy to handle, before if i got to 4.3 - 4.5 i was allready dizzy, now i can go as low as 3 and not have any problems at all...i do feel it and have time to correct wich is nice... ... It takes some time to get used tho.. Be carefull with your basal, youll need much less the transition may be a bit tricky, This one puzzled me for a bit You'll need a bit of bolus (1 or 2U) for weight training, especialy in the morning (effectivly your body will produse glucose on demand, for explosive muscle movement ) After 2-4 weeks, your body will start to turn protein to glucose...there are a couple of solutions, this happens some 3-5 hours after eating... There are a couple of solutions to this.. Bolusing twice or my favorite: using R ibsulins.. I hope this helps you, dm me if you need any advices... You can also google Dr bernstein.. Or search for DR Bozz on youtube for more info..
Just keep going...in 3 weeks its going to be a part of your normal day...and from there itngets realy easy...
I swear to god..i dont even notice it anymore... The beggining is hard tho... Eating keto helps to...

Just stick to it... 20 will feel like 16 in a couple of days... Im at 18 currently, couldn't stick to 20:4 but not because i was hungry, but because i couldnt eat the second meal like i should, i was too full...

WRITING.TITLE: Instinctivly feeling high BG
WRITING.TEXT: Hy guys, i've just wandered how do you guys feel when your BG rises and at what point are you usually Able to sense it... For me it's a sensation of going to bathroom on an empty blader, or breathing kind of heavely, as if after a hard workout... I used to sense it aroun 15.ish but now on a low carb diet i can feel it as early as 10 or 11... Obviously the CGM crew has much less nees for such skills...
Theey dont test for what? Tell that to nick diaz...
